page.title: 12St. Blasius Church
page.content: The Manor of Shanklin was mentioned in the first Domesday Book. There is evidence of the existence of a chapel in the 13th century attached to the Manor. St Blasius did not become a Parish Church in its own right until the middle of the last century in 1853.There are many interesting things in the church. A heavy oak chest dated 1512, a lot of very old silver and an old organ. The church holds about 250 people and has a bell tower with three bells. The grave yard is one acre with about 366 graves. The Lych Gate was erected by Shanklin residents in 1894 as a memorial to Francis White Popham, last resident Lord Of The Manor.{
